properties.areaDesc: Lawrence, IN; Jackson, IN; Washington, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 8:38PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...East Fork White River...Eel River...Mill Creek...
Mississinewa River...Wabash River...White River...Youngs Creek...


.Precipitation of up to about 2 inches fell Sunday into Monday,
heaviest within 50 miles north and south of Interstate 70 across
the state. Flooding is expected to occur at several locations on
the Wabash River from Lafayette southward, and on the White River
from Anderson southward. Flooding along the lower reaches will
last past February 20.

The latest forecast model data is predicting flood crests to
generally be close to, but probably slightly below, what we saw in
January. Crests along the White River are expected to come close to
moderate flood state at Spencer, Elliston, Newberry, and
Edwardsport. County, state, and federal roads and some river cabins
may be impacted.  In addition, a few homes in Waverly may be
affected. The Mississinewa River near Ridgeville will come near or
perhaps onto State Road 1 near State Road 28.

Flooding on the Driftwood River is expected to last no more than a
couple days.

The Flood Warning continues for
The East Fork White River at Seymour.
* until further notice.
* At  7:45 PM Monday the stage was 11.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by this evening and continue to
rise to near 16.0 feet by late Tuesday night.
* At 16.0 feet...Extensive lowland flooding affecting agricultural
lands.   Many county and state roads in flood plain become
impassable by high water.  These include SR 235 East of Medora...SR
258 East of Cortland...County Road 725 N and possibly State Road 39
South of Tampico.  High water affects county roads near Vallonia
and Shields...Ewing Road near Brownstown...County road 525 North
near Seymour wastewater treatment plant...Honeytown Road and
possibly state roads 250 East of Dudleytown and 256 west of Austin.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
